intro: Hypoestes cumingiana, commonly known as the "Snowflake" plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored, tubular bracts that resemble tiny flowers. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overshadowed by the vibrant foliage. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Hypoestes cumingiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in indoor settings.
